content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Preservers seed Vulcanoid peoples in the Romulus/Remus system, previously devoid of intelligent life. Seven settlements were established at the sites of the modern city-states of Caranam, Portora, Kanassarum, Labasasz, Dinalla, Pulla'd and Farrad.

gsx$event.$t: The Preservers seed Vulcanoid peoples in the Romulus/Remus system, previously devoid of intelligent life. Seven settlements were established at the sites of the modern city-states of Caranam, Portora, Kanassarum, Labasasz, Dinalla, Pulla'd and Farrad.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: D'Sivas is settled by Farrad.

gsx$event.$t: D'Sivas is settled by Farrad.

content.$t:
full: TRUE, event: Labasasz and Portora make contact and combat over soft-metal 
deposits. The results are inconclusive.

gsx$event.$t:
Labasasz and Portora make contact and combat over soft-metal 
deposits. The results are inconclusive.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Ranassa settled by Portora. Timuraasz settled by Dinalla.

gsx$event.$t: Ranassa settled by Portora. Timuraasz settled by Dinalla.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Calanista and Manasa settled by Caranam.

gsx$event.$t: Calanista and Manasa settled by Caranam.

content.$t: stardateend: -3/0101.01, full: TRUE, event: Constant conflict begin between city-states and tribes, frequently over Romulus' scant resources. Caranam, Portora, Kanassarum, Labasasz, Dinalla, Pulla'd, Farrad, D'Sivas, Ranassa, Timuraasz, Calanista and Manasan emerge as world leaders.

gsx$event.$t: Constant conflict begin between city-states and tribes, frequently over Romulus' scant resources. Caranam, Portora, Kanassarum, Labasasz, Dinalla, Pulla'd, Farrad, D'Sivas, Ranassa, Timuraasz, Calanista and Manasan emerge as world leaders.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Vanous of Calanista postulates that Remus is inhabitable, heralding in the Age of Discovery. Although legends existed of life on other planets, this is the first time scientific evidence is presented to support the legends and theories.

gsx$event.$t: Vanous of Calanista postulates that Remus is inhabitable, heralding in the Age of Discovery. Although legends existed of life on other planets, this is the first time scientific evidence is presented to support the legends and theories.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: L'Tokus of Finalla successfully launches a large payload-carrying rocket into the upper atmosphere. Previously, rockets, though used in celebrations, rarely had been used militarily.

gsx$event.$t: L'Tokus of Finalla successfully launches a large payload-carrying rocket into the upper atmosphere. Previously, rockets, though used in celebrations, rarely had been used militarily.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Timuraasz places first payload into orbit around Romulus.

gsx$event.$t: Timuraasz places first payload into orbit around Romulus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Dinalla puts the first Romulan in orbit.

gsx$event.$t: Dinalla puts the first Romulan in orbit.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: War breaks out between Dinalla and Timuraasz over the resources necessary for space travel.The war soon spreads to other places on the planet, as no city-state dares allow others to gather the necessary resources for space travel, fearing the loss of military advantage. Up to this time, Dinalla and Timuraasz are the only two city- states that had managed to send anyone into space, though several others, most notably Labasasz and Caranam, are close to accomplishing space ventures.

gsx$event.$t: War breaks out between Dinalla and Timuraasz over the resources necessary for space travel.The war soon spreads to other places on the planet, as no city-state dares allow others to gather the necessary resources for space travel, fearing the loss of military advantage. Up to this time, Dinalla and Timuraasz are the only two city- states that had managed to send anyone into space, though several others, most notably Labasasz and Caranam, are close to accomplishing space ventures.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The treaty of Kanassarum is signed, the warring factions having exhausted themselves and their meager resources by this time. The war produces no real winners.

gsx$event.$t: The treaty of Kanassarum is signed, the warring factions having exhausted themselves and their meager resources by this time. The war produces no real winners.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: At a meeting of the elder statesmen of all the city-states, the great scientist/statesman L'Deus of Portora proposes that the city-states band together to reach Remus. He shows without a doubt that limited resources would prevent any one city-state from acomplishing the goal on its own. He uses the old legends and combines them with the example of the past and the realities of the present to make his appeal. After 7 months of effort, he gives up in disgust. The meeting breaks up without the unification needed.

gsx$event.$t: At a meeting of the elder statesmen of all the city-states, the great scientist/statesman L'Deus of Portora proposes that the city-states band together to reach Remus. He shows without a doubt that limited resources would prevent any one city-state from acomplishing the goal on its own. He uses the old legends and combines them with the example of the past and the realities of the present to make his appeal. After 7 months of effort, he gives up in disgust. The meeting breaks up without the unification needed.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Dinalla attempts a launch to establish a semi-permanent space station. The vessel, using inferior fuel, exploded on the pad.

gsx$event.$t: Dinalla attempts a launch to establish a semi-permanent space station. The vessel, using inferior fuel, exploded on the pad.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Second Conference of Portora is held, with representatives from all city-states. L'Deus refuses to lead the converence or even participate except for answering questions. The conference lasts 4 months. Seeing that alone their city-states could not reach the stars, the representatives agree to join together.

gsx$event.$t: Second Conference of Portora is held, with representatives from all city-states. L'Deus refuses to lead the converence or even participate except for answering questions. The conference lasts 4 months. Seeing that alone their city-states could not reach the stars, the representatives agree to join together.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The D'Vatta (Great Paper) is signed, unifying all city-states into one organization, the Bresasam Rom'Lnz (Romulan Confederation). The debates over the form the government will take last less than 4 months.

gsx$event.$t: The D'Vatta (Great Paper) is signed, unifying all city-states into one organization, the Bresasam Rom'Lnz (Romulan Confederation). The debates over the form the government will take last less than 4 months.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: L'Deus is elected first Emperor of the Romulan Confederation by the Imperial Senate after the Senators convince him that the position is part of his destiny.

gsx$event.$t: L'Deus is elected first Emperor of the Romulan Confederation by the Imperial Senate after the Senators convince him that the position is part of his destiny.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Because of its location central to needed resources, Kanassarum is chosen as the site of the new united space effort.

gsx$event.$t: Because of its location central to needed resources, Kanassarum is chosen as the site of the new united space effort.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first Confederation manned flight is launched.

gsx$event.$t: The first Confederation manned flight is launched.

content.$t: stardateend: -2/1206.00, full: TRUE, event: This period of many manned flights culminates in the establishment of a large orbital station to be used as a platform for the Remus effort.

gsx$event.$t: This period of many manned flights culminates in the establishment of a large orbital station to be used as a platform for the Remus effort.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first unmanned probe lands on Remus

gsx$event.$t: The first unmanned probe lands on Remus

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first manned mission lands on Remus, with only one astronaut aboard the vessel. S'Tanet, since become not only famous for her adventure but intertwined with legend, reports that the surface has a breathable atmosphere and life.

gsx$event.$t: The first manned mission lands on Remus, with only one astronaut aboard the vessel. S'Tanet, since become not only famous for her adventure but intertwined with legend, reports that the surface has a breathable atmosphere and life.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A temporary research facility is established at Levitasz, the site of S'Tanet's historic landing; it is abandoned one year later.

gsx$event.$t: A temporary research facility is established at Levitasz, the site of S'Tanet's historic landing; it is abandoned one year later.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A large, manned station is constructed orbiting Remus. This base is continually enlarged over succeeding years, serving as the launch facility for further expeditions to Remus.

gsx$event.$t: A large, manned station is constructed orbiting Remus. This base is continually enlarged over succeeding years, serving as the launch facility for further expeditions to Remus.

content.$t: stardateend: -2/2900.00, full: TRUE, event: Seven manned and 36 unmanned landings are made on Remus. None of the manned bases, used primarily as centers for mapping, testing, and research expeditions, lasts for more than 1 year.

gsx$event.$t: Seven manned and 36 unmanned landings are made on Remus. None of the manned bases, used primarily as centers for mapping, testing, and research expeditions, lasts for more than 1 year.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first permanent colony, called Adrennan, is established on Remus. Thirty-seven settlers arrive aboard 3 shuttles from the orbiting station.

gsx$event.$t: The first permanent colony, called Adrennan, is established on Remus. Thirty-seven settlers arrive aboard 3 shuttles from the orbiting station.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Remus Colony of Biscae is established near large mineral deposits.

gsx$event.$t: The Remus Colony of Biscae is established near large mineral deposits.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The port of Rinum is established on Remus, destined to become the major planetside port, used to export resources both to the orbiting station and to Romulus.

gsx$event.$t: The port of Rinum is established on Remus, destined to become the major planetside port, used to export resources both to the orbiting station and to Romulus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Levitasz, the site of the first manned landing on Remus, is established as a permanent settlement.

gsx$event.$t: Levitasz, the site of the first manned landing on Remus, is established as a permanent settlement.

content.$t: stardateend: -2/5100.00, full: TRUE, event: These two decades see the first 4 colonies on Remus grow into city-states, recognized alongside those on Romulus. Population and trade grow geometrically, and the Remus government at Biscae is forced to allow other colonies to be established. The other 8 city-states on Remus were established to provide homes for the rapid influx of settlers.

gsx$event.$t: These two decades see the first 4 colonies on Remus grow into city-states, recognized alongside those on Romulus. Population and trade grow geometrically, and the Remus government at Biscae is forced to allow other colonies to be established. The other 8 city-states on Remus were established to provide homes for the rapid influx of settlers.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Shanerea colony is established on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: Shanerea colony is established on Remus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Hetharri and Yenalian settlements on Remus file papers establishing permanent colonies on the same day, beginning the tradition of friendly rivalry between them.

gsx$event.$t: Hetharri and Yenalian settlements on Remus file papers establishing permanent colonies on the same day, beginning the tradition of friendly rivalry between them.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first expedition to the planet S'Latas departs from D'Raxna station in orbit about Remus. The expedition consists of 9 scientists, 2 astronaut/pilots, and 5 military/security specialists.

gsx$event.$t: The first expedition to the planet S'Latas departs from D'Raxna station in orbit about Remus. The expedition consists of 9 scientists, 2 astronaut/pilots, and 5 military/security specialists.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The S'Latas expedition arrives in orbit about the third planet and finds it lifeless and uninhabitable. One of the planet's 2 moons, however, has a very thin atmosphere and mollusk-like primitive life. The moon is named S'Tanet.

gsx$event.$t: The S'Latas expedition arrives in orbit about the third planet and finds it lifeless and uninhabitable. One of the planet's 2 moons, however, has a very thin atmosphere and mollusk-like primitive life. The moon is named S'Tanet.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A small shuttle with 2 military/security specialists, 1 pilot, and 2 scientists lands on S'Tanet, discovering it to be rich enough to make domed facilities worthwhile.

gsx$event.$t: A small shuttle with 2 military/security specialists, 1 pilot, and 2 scientists lands on S'Tanet, discovering it to be rich enough to make domed facilities worthwhile.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The moons of the planets D'Lanam and Ulunam are found to be relatively rich in mineral resources, starting immense mining efforts there.

gsx$event.$t: The moons of the planets D'Lanam and Ulunam are found to be relatively rich in mineral resources, starting immense mining efforts there.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The first manned starfaring expedition is launched to the nearest star, Perhonies.

gsx$event.$t: The first manned starfaring expedition is launched to the nearest star, Perhonies.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Patarrasz settlement is established on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: Patarrasz settlement is established on Remus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The setlements of Destallasz and Valassa are established on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: The setlements of Destallasz and Valassa are established on Remus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Paieu settlement is opened on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: The Paieu settlement is opened on Remus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A habitable planet is found in the Perhonies system. The planet is in an earlier stage of development than Romulus and has no intelligent life forms.

gsx$event.$t: A habitable planet is found in the Perhonies system. The planet is in an earlier stage of development than Romulus and has no intelligent life forms.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Nabatha colony is established on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: The Nabatha colony is established on Remus.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Several expeditions are launched simultaneously from the Romulus system to neighboring star systems in a search for usable planets and valuable resources. All are launched coreward, in keeping with the "Road to the Stars" philosophy.

gsx$event.$t: Several expeditions are launched simultaneously from the Romulus system to neighboring star systems in a search for usable planets and valuable resources. All are launched coreward, in keeping with the "Road to the Stars" philosophy.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Biscae is made capital city-state of Remus. Its mineral deposits have made it the fastest-growing colony on Remus for 40 years or more, as well as the planet's commercial center.

gsx$event.$t: Biscae is made capital city-state of Remus. Its mineral deposits have made it the fastest-growing colony on Remus for 40 years or more, as well as the planet's commercial center.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The expedition to gorwah lands on a planet dominated by a humanoid life form having a civilization not as advanced as the Romulans'. The people are conquered easily, making Gorwah the first culture absorbed into the Confederation.

gsx$event.$t: The expedition to gorwah lands on a planet dominated by a humanoid life form having a civilization not as advanced as the Romulans'. The people are conquered easily, making Gorwah the first culture absorbed into the Confederation.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: By this time, the Romulan Confederation has established colonies on 27 planets coreward.

gsx$event.$t: By this time, the Romulan Confederation has established colonies on 27 planets coreward.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: At this point, the Romulans have 73 colonies and have conquered 27 other planets, resulting in 100 Romulan settlements. The Romulan Confederation changes its name to Latasam Stelai Rom'lnz (Romulan Star Empire), which translates literally as "Star Road of the People". It takes the form of government it has today.

gsx$event.$t: At this point, the Romulans have 73 colonies and have conquered 27 other planets, resulting in 100 Romulan settlements. The Romulan Confederation changes its name to Latasam Stelai Rom'lnz (Romulan Star Empire), which translates literally as "Star Road of the People". It takes the form of government it has today.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Romulans are attacked spinward by the Corillians, a race previously unknown to them. Having little force in this direction, the Romulans sustain heavy losses. The war lasts six months, after which the Corellians, a much less populous culture than the Romulans, are conquered. They are the first space-faring culture to be subjugated by the Star Empire.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulans are attacked spinward by the Corillians, a race previously unknown to them. Having little force in this direction, the Romulans sustain heavy losses. The war lasts six months, after which the Corellians, a much less populous culture than the Romulans, are conquered. They are the first space-faring culture to be subjugated by the Star Empire.

content.$t: stardateend: -1/8600.00, full: TRUE, event: The Corillian Incident points out the necessity of watching in all directions, not just the coreward direction of main expansion. Because of this, the Empire enters a period of consolidation, strengthening their existing borders.

gsx$event.$t: The Corillian Incident points out the necessity of watching in all directions, not just the coreward direction of main expansion. Because of this, the Empire enters a period of consolidation, strengthening their existing borders.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Expansion begins spinward.

gsx$event.$t: Expansion begins spinward.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: At this point, the Romulan Empire numbes 216 colonies and planets.

gsx$event.$t: At this point, the Romulan Empire numbes 216 colonies and planets.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: First contact with the Klingon Empire occurs at Delta Khinah II, when a Romulan scout vessel is attacked without provocation. The vessel, the L'Sattak, self-destructs after sending log tapes homeward.

gsx$event.$t: First contact with the Klingon Empire occurs at Delta Khinah II, when a Romulan scout vessel is attacked without provocation. The vessel, the L'Sattak, self-destructs after sending log tapes homeward.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The First Romulan-Klingon War starts.

gsx$event.$t: The First Romulan-Klingon War starts.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The First War ends. Having taken heavy losses, the Star Empire pulls back slightly, giving up two outposts. The Klingons do not pursue, not being in a position to do so, though this is unknown to the Romulans. From this time to present, minor skirmishes occur between the Romulans and the Klingons.

gsx$event.$t: The First War ends. Having taken heavy losses, the Star Empire pulls back slightly, giving up two outposts. The Klingons do not pursue, not being in a position to do so, though this is unknown to the Romulans. From this time to present, minor skirmishes occur between the Romulans and the Klingons.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Star Empire begins a period of slow, cautious expansion in the direction of the Klingon Empire. The expansion ends 40 years later, setting the boundaries for what is known today as The Triangle, where many of the recurring skirmishes between these two powers and the UFP take place.

gsx$event.$t: The Star Empire begins a period of slow, cautious expansion in the direction of the Klingon Empire. The expansion ends 40 years later, setting the boundaries for what is known today as The Triangle, where many of the recurring skirmishes between these two powers and the UFP take place.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: First contact with the United Federation of Planets occurs when a Federation cargo ship wanders into Romulan territory. It is destroyed by Romulan patrol craft. At first, the Romulans suspect that Federation incursions into their space may be Klingon deception. Later, the Imperial Council, remembering the "Klingon Lesson", decides not to risk negotiation with the UFP, in the hope that destruction of all intruders will keep the UFP from expanding into Romulan Space.

gsx$event.$t: First contact with the United Federation of Planets occurs when a Federation cargo ship wanders into Romulan territory. It is destroyed by Romulan patrol craft. At first, the Romulans suspect that Federation incursions into their space may be Klingon deception. Later, the Imperial Council, remembering the "Klingon Lesson", decides not to risk negotiation with the UFP, in the hope that destruction of all intruders will keep the UFP from expanding into Romulan Space.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Star Empire declares war on the UFP.

gsx$event.$t: The Star Empire declares war on the UFP.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The Romulan-UFP War is ended inconclusively, after staggering losses on both sides. The treaty, negotiated by subspace radio, establishes a Neutral Zone no ships are allowed to cross between the two powers. No Federation forces have ever seen a Romulan face-to-face, mostly becaus the Romulans refuse to allow a ship to be captured intact.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulan-UFP War is ended inconclusively, after staggering losses on both sides. The treaty, negotiated by subspace radio, establishes a Neutral Zone no ships are allowed to cross between the two powers. No Federation forces have ever seen a Romulan face-to-face, mostly becaus the Romulans refuse to allow a ship to be captured intact.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: At this time, realizing thaty they are technologically out-classed and outnumbered, and that they have no hope of winning a prolonged conflict, the Romulans consolidate along the new UFP-Romulan Neutral Zone. They begin major construction of outposts to keep track of Federation forces and keep them in check. Just homeward of these outposts, forces for future expansion into Federation territory are built.

gsx$event.$t: At this time, realizing thaty they are technologically out-classed and outnumbered, and that they have no hope of winning a prolonged conflict, the Romulans consolidate along the new UFP-Romulan Neutral Zone. They begin major construction of outposts to keep track of Federation forces and keep them in check. Just homeward of these outposts, forces for future expansion into Federation territory are built.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The plasma weapon is invented, giving new hope to the Star Empire forces on the Klingon and Federation borders. The weapon is made operational in two years, and modifications are made periodically, resulting in several variants at present.

gsx$event.$t: The plasma weapon is invented, giving new hope to the Star Empire forces on the Klingon and Federation borders. The weapon is made operational in two years, and modifications are made periodically, resulting in several variants at present.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The cloaking device is perfected and is used successfully in vessels on the Klingon border.

gsx$event.$t: The cloaking device is perfected and is used successfully in vessels on the Klingon border.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: Cleaking devices, much perfected by this time, are installed on vessels operating on the UFP border. Smaller vessels are equipped first and sent into Federation territory to learn what they can of Federation forces and their disposition. Instructed not to let the Federation discover they are Romulan vessels, they are given orders to self-destruct if caught. These privateers capture or destroy many Federation merchants and scouts. The Federation is unaware of the true nature of the disappearances for some time, and attributes them to Orions and other pirates.

gsx$event.$t: Cleaking devices, much perfected by this time, are installed on vessels operating on the UFP border. Smaller vessels are equipped first and sent into Federation territory to learn what they can of Federation forces and their disposition. Instructed not to let the Federation discover they are Romulan vessels, they are given orders to self-destruct if caught. These privateers capture or destroy many Federation merchants and scouts. The Federation is unaware of the true nature of the disappearances for some time, and attributes them to Orions and other pirates.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: In an attempt to stop the seemingly endless and inconclusive battles between the two powers, the first Romulan/Klingon non-aggression and technological treaties are signed at Villam III, near The Triangle. Afraid of the apparent growing military might of the UFP, the Romulans and Klingons decide to concentrate on this common enemy. The Romulans, currently ahead in territory, give up many disputed planets as well as the plans for an older-model cloaking device and the plasma weapon. In return, the Klingons provide a number of older D-7 ships equipped with Klingon weapons and engines.

gsx$event.$t: In an attempt to stop the seemingly endless and inconclusive battles between the two powers, the first Romulan/Klingon non-aggression and technological treaties are signed at Villam III, near The Triangle. Afraid of the apparent growing military might of the UFP, the Romulans and Klingons decide to concentrate on this common enemy. The Romulans, currently ahead in territory, give up many disputed planets as well as the plans for an older-model cloaking device and the plasma weapon. In return, the Klingons provide a number of older D-7 ships equipped with Klingon weapons and engines.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The USS Enterprise seizes a cloaking device on a mission in the Romulan Neutral Zone. The unit is made to function once, but is later catastrophically destroyed, preventing the UFP from gaining the secret of its construction.

gsx$event.$t: The USS Enterprise seizes a cloaking device on a mission in the Romulan Neutral Zone. The unit is made to function once, but is later catastrophically destroyed, preventing the UFP from gaining the secret of its construction.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The second Romulan/Klingon treaty is signed. The Romulans gain bases coreward of The Triangle. The Klingons gain a much-desired, mineral-rich planet in The Triangle itself. Both sides feel they have come out ahead.

gsx$event.$t: The second Romulan/Klingon treaty is signed. The Romulans gain bases coreward of The Triangle. The Klingons gain a much-desired, mineral-rich planet in The Triangle itself. Both sides feel they have come out ahead.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: The third Romulan/Kllingon treaty is signed. The Romulans gain access to new weaponry and advanced mining equipment. The Klingons gain a 12-man, scout-sized Bird-of-Prey, which they put into widespread use as a raider, and on which they base several larger ship designs of their own.

gsx$event.$t: The third Romulan/Kllingon treaty is signed. The Romulans gain access to new weaponry and advanced mining equipment. The Klingons gain a 12-man, scout-sized Bird-of-Prey, which they put into widespread use as a raider, and on which they base several larger ship designs of their own.

content.$t: full: TRUE, event: A Romulan scoutship is fired on by a Gorn Battleship while in a system recently brought under Gorn control. Gorn fire severs the warp engine nacelle of the Romulan craft, limiting its self-destructive capability. The Gorn salvage much of the wreckage, learning about the Romulans.

gsx$event.$t: A Romulan scoutship is fired on by a Gorn Battleship while in a system recently brought under Gorn control. Gorn fire severs the warp engine nacelle of the Romulan craft, limiting its self-destructive capability. The Gorn salvage much of the wreckage, learning about the Romulans.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Preservers are thought to have seeded the Romulas/Remus system with Vulcanoids

gsx$event.$t: The Preservers are thought to have seeded the Romulas/Remus system with Vulcanoids

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Romulans develop unmanned space flight.

gsx$event.$t: Romulans develop unmanned space flight.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Romulan Confederation is organized, linking all city-states. L'Deus was elected first Emperor.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulan Confederation is organized, linking all city-states. L'Deus was elected first Emperor.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: First Romulan manned space flight, launched from the city-state of Kanassarum.

gsx$event.$t: First Romulan manned space flight, launched from the city-state of Kanassarum.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The first Romulan unmanned probe lands on Remus

gsx$event.$t: The first Romulan unmanned probe lands on Remus

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The first Romulan manned mission to Remus lands successfully, piloted by a female Romulan named S'Tanet. Her actual exploits soon become intertwined with fiction until the two are indiscernible.

gsx$event.$t: The first Romulan manned mission to Remus lands successfully, piloted by a female Romulan named S'Tanet. Her actual exploits soon become intertwined with fiction until the two are indiscernible.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The first permanent colony is established on Remus.

gsx$event.$t: The first permanent colony is established on Remus.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Romulans mount their first expedition to nearby planets; it departs from the Remus port of Rinum.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulans mount their first expedition to nearby planets; it departs from the Remus port of Rinum.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The first Romulan manned interstellar expedition is launched to Perhonies.

gsx$event.$t: The first Romulan manned interstellar expedition is launched to Perhonies.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Romulans launch massive interstellar exploratory efforts coreward.

gsx$event.$t: Romulans launch massive interstellar exploratory efforts coreward.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Romulans conquer the peoples of Gorwah, the first culture to be absorbed.

gsx$event.$t: Romulans conquer the peoples of Gorwah, the first culture to be absorbed.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: By this time, the Romulans have approximately 100 settlements on othe worlds. The Romulan Confederation changes its name to the Romulan Star Empire an the Romulans establish the form of government they have today.

gsx$event.$t: By this time, the Romulans have approximately 100 settlements on othe worlds. The Romulan Confederation changes its name to the Romulan Star Empire an the Romulans establish the form of government they have today.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Romulans are attacked spinward by a race unknown to them, the Corillians. The Romulans, having little force in this direction, sustain heavy losses. The valiant Corillians, much fewer than the Romulans, are eventually conquered, the first star-faring race to be subjugated by the Romulans.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulans are attacked spinward by a race unknown to them, the Corillians. The Romulans, having little force in this direction, sustain heavy losses. The valiant Corillians, much fewer than the Romulans, are eventually conquered, the first star-faring race to be subjugated by the Romulans.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Captured Klingon documents indicate that the Romulans first make contact with the Klingons during this year, leading to full-scale war lasting over 3 years, with neither side gaining any major advantage in the end.

gsx$event.$t: Captured Klingon documents indicate that the Romulans first make contact with the Klingons during this year, leading to full-scale war lasting over 3 years, with neither side gaining any major advantage in the end.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Federation cargo vessel Atlas is listed as missing after failing to arrive when scheduled.

gsx$event.$t: Federation cargo vessel Atlas is listed as missing after failing to arrive when scheduled.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Marker/recorder buoy from the lost cargo vessel Atlas is recovered by Starfleet. Tapes from the buoy reveal that the ship was not lost in space, but was fired upon by enemy aliens of unknown origin. Intercepted subspace radio transmissions are included, giving the UFP the first recordings of the Romulan Language. Videotapes depict the second pass of the alien ship, painted like a giant bird. The Atlas' Captain reports his drive is inoperative and his shields failing, as the enemy vessel rounds for another run; he also reports his intention to release the buoy before the Atlas can be attacked again.

gsx$event.$t: Marker/recorder buoy from the lost cargo vessel Atlas is recovered by Starfleet. Tapes from the buoy reveal that the ship was not lost in space, but was fired upon by enemy aliens of unknown origin. Intercepted subspace radio transmissions are included, giving the UFP the first recordings of the Romulan Language. Videotapes depict the second pass of the alien ship, painted like a giant bird. The Atlas' Captain reports his drive is inoperative and his shields failing, as the enemy vessel rounds for another run; he also reports his intention to release the buoy before the Atlas can be attacked again.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Federation Council drafts and passes by acclamation a directive calling for the outfitting of a special UFP fleet to strengthen defenses in the area where the Atlas was lost. Twelve deep-space probes, each manned by 15 volunteers, scatter through unknown space in the region, trying to obtain information on the unknown enemy race. None return.

gsx$event.$t: The Federation Council drafts and passes by acclamation a directive calling for the outfitting of a special UFP fleet to strengthen defenses in the area where the Atlas was lost. Twelve deep-space probes, each manned by 15 volunteers, scatter through unknown space in the region, trying to obtain information on the unknown enemy race. None return.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Century Day celebrations on Luna and elsewhere throughout colonized space are interrupted with news of the destruction of 3 Federation heavy cruisers, presumably lost to forces associated with the unseen enemy. One small destroyer attached to the same fleet survives to report about the sneak attack, in which vessels painted as giant, winged creatures performed suicide runs with fusion-explosive missiles. Intercepted subspace radio transmissions from this battle are translated, finally giving the enemy a name - the Romulans. The UFP also obtains its first bearings on Romulan-held space.

gsx$event.$t: Century Day celebrations on Luna and elsewhere throughout colonized space are interrupted with news of the destruction of 3 Federation heavy cruisers, presumably lost to forces associated with the unseen enemy. One small destroyer attached to the same fleet survives to report about the sneak attack, in which vessels painted as giant, winged creatures performed suicide runs with fusion-explosive missiles. Intercepted subspace radio transmissions from this battle are translated, finally giving the enemy a name - the Romulans. The UFP also obtains its first bearings on Romulan-held space.

content.$t: stardateend: 1/0601.00, full: FALSE, event: Several more run-ins between Romulan and UFP forces occur, the Federation beginning to develop some ideas on how to deal with Romulan hit-and-run tactics. On Stardate 1/0522.07, two Romulan vessels are crippled by a Starfleet strike force. The Romulan commanders wait until several ships maneuver close for grappling and boarding, then self-destruct, taking the UFP ships with them as they explode. Standing orders are issued prohibiting Federation vessels from closing with even a badly-damaged Romulan vessel.

gsx$event.$t: Several more run-ins between Romulan and UFP forces occur, the Federation beginning to develop some ideas on how to deal with Romulan hit-and-run tactics. On Stardate 1/0522.07, two Romulan vessels are crippled by a Starfleet strike force. The Romulan commanders wait until several ships maneuver close for grappling and boarding, then self-destruct, taking the UFP ships with them as they explode. Standing orders are issued prohibiting Federation vessels from closing with even a badly-damaged Romulan vessel.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: War is declared between the Federation and the Romulan Star Empire. In this unprecedented action, the UFP moves against an enemy whose planetary holdings and bases, political structure, aims and philosophies and even appearance is completely unknown. Intercepted and translated subspace radio communications are translated and analyzed to help the UFP understand their foe.

gsx$event.$t: War is declared between the Federation and the Romulan Star Empire. In this unprecedented action, the UFP moves against an enemy whose planetary holdings and bases, political structure, aims and philosophies and even appearance is completely unknown. Intercepted and translated subspace radio communications are translated and analyzed to help the UFP understand their foe.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: A Fedreation fleet stumbles on a major Romulan base, dealing with the enemy its first true defeat. Over 30 Romulan war-vessels, manned by only skeleton crews during resupply operations, are destroyed in orbit before they can fire a shot. Six Starfleet vessels are lost in the engagement when the planetary base destroys itself after its shields had been damaged seriously. The loss to the Romulan fleet is crippling, and the Romulan war effort never fully recovers.

gsx$event.$t: A Fedreation fleet stumbles on a major Romulan base, dealing with the enemy its first true defeat. Over 30 Romulan war-vessels, manned by only skeleton crews during resupply operations, are destroyed in orbit before they can fire a shot. Six Starfleet vessels are lost in the engagement when the planetary base destroys itself after its shields had been damaged seriously. The loss to the Romulan fleet is crippling, and the Romulan war effort never fully recovers.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Romulan-UFP War is ended inconclusively, after staggering losses on both sides. Neither side is able to supply adequately to maintain a fleet in the war zone, and the UFP has been unable to mount a fleet strong enough to penetrate Romulan space to reach the supposed location of the Romulan home world. Because of this, Federation Senior Councilman Abraham Dannon convinces his colleagues to make a peace offer; the measure is accepted by a 1-vote margin. The treaty, negotiated by subspace radio, is accepted, with the provision that no members of the warring races meet face-to-face. No Federation forces have ever seen a Romulan face-to-face throughout the entire war, mostly due to the Romulan refusal to allow a ship to be captured intact.

gsx$event.$t: The Romulan-UFP War is ended inconclusively, after staggering losses on both sides. Neither side is able to supply adequately to maintain a fleet in the war zone, and the UFP has been unable to mount a fleet strong enough to penetrate Romulan space to reach the supposed location of the Romulan home world. Because of this, Federation Senior Councilman Abraham Dannon convinces his colleagues to make a peace offer; the measure is accepted by a 1-vote margin. The treaty, negotiated by subspace radio, is accepted, with the provision that no members of the warring races meet face-to-face. No Federation forces have ever seen a Romulan face-to-face throughout the entire war, mostly due to the Romulan refusal to allow a ship to be captured intact.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Neutral Zone, established by the peace treaty, is set up after much haggling over its exact dimensions and location. Ironically, the negotiations destroy the political aspirations of Councilman Dannon when his opponents claim that he, as chief negotiator, gave away too much of the disputed area to the Romulans.

gsx$event.$t: The Neutral Zone, established by the peace treaty, is set up after much haggling over its exact dimensions and location. Ironically, the negotiations destroy the political aspirations of Councilman Dannon when his opponents claim that he, as chief negotiator, gave away too much of the disputed area to the Romulans.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Abraham Dannon, author of the Romulan/Federation peace treaty and chief negotiator of its provisions, dies at the age of 59, assassinated by a spectator at a political rally where he was scheduled to speak. A controversial, much despised figure in his own time, he is now revered for his contributions to galactic peace; the Terran civilian decoration for peace, The Dannon Prize, is named for him.

gsx$event.$t: Abraham Dannon, author of the Romulan/Federation peace treaty and chief negotiator of its provisions, dies at the age of 59, assassinated by a spectator at a political rally where he was scheduled to speak. A controversial, much despised figure in his own time, he is now revered for his contributions to galactic peace; the Terran civilian decoration for peace, The Dannon Prize, is named for him.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Starfleet's initial network of manned and automated border outposts becoms operational along the Neutral Zone. The system is expanded and improved during the following 30 years, until most military theorists consider it impossible for a ship to cross the Zone undetected. It is assumed that a similar network has been created by the Romulans. This is supported by the fact that, of the 17 Federation space vessels known to have penetrated the Neutral Zone, none has returned nor has left any trace.

gsx$event.$t: Starfleet's initial network of manned and automated border outposts becoms operational along the Neutral Zone. The system is expanded and improved during the following 30 years, until most military theorists consider it impossible for a ship to cross the Zone undetected. It is assumed that a similar network has been created by the Romulans. This is supported by the fact that, of the 17 Federation space vessels known to have penetrated the Neutral Zone, none has returned nor has left any trace.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: First contact with the Klingon Empire leads to armed conflict. Information obtained from spies and from Klingon prisoners lead to the inescapable conclusion that the Klingons and the Romulans have met. That they seem to be old and bitter foes comes as a relief. The "Klingon Menace" begins to overshadow conflict with the Romulans.

gsx$event.$t: First contact with the Klingon Empire leads to armed conflict. Information obtained from spies and from Klingon prisoners lead to the inescapable conclusion that the Klingons and the Romulans have met. That they seem to be old and bitter foes comes as a relief. The "Klingon Menace" begins to overshadow conflict with the Romulans.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Four Years War with the Klingons and the Axanar star system begins. Though tactical experts expact the Romulans to enter the war on one side or the other, they do not.

gsx$event.$t: The Four Years War with the Klingons and the Axanar star system begins. Though tactical experts expact the Romulans to enter the war on one side or the other, they do not.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The vast build-up of Klingon military might, reported by Federation intelligence, has totally eclipsed all fear of the long-dormant "Romulan Problem". The complacency of Starfleet and the UFP is shattered when a Romulan vessel, using electronic cloaking to shield it from detection, destroys 4 Neutral Zone border outposts with a new, powerful plasma weapon. Pursued by the USS Enterprise, the Romulan ship is chased into the Neutral Zone and destroyed before it can report. In the pursuit, the Enterprise taps into Romulan shipboard communications and picks up images from the Romulan bridge, revealing the Romulans to be Vulcanoid in appearance.

gsx$event.$t: The vast build-up of Klingon military might, reported by Federation intelligence, has totally eclipsed all fear of the long-dormant "Romulan Problem". The complacency of Starfleet and the UFP is shattered when a Romulan vessel, using electronic cloaking to shield it from detection, destroys 4 Neutral Zone border outposts with a new, powerful plasma weapon. Pursued by the USS Enterprise, the Romulan ship is chased into the Neutral Zone and destroyed before it can report. In the pursuit, the Enterprise taps into Romulan shipboard communications and picks up images from the Romulan bridge, revealing the Romulans to be Vulcanoid in appearance.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The Vulcan Academy of Science stuns the Federation, but helps to allay fears of Vulcan/Romulan collusion, when it publicises its theory concerning the Romulans' Vulcan heritage. This theory postulates a race known as The Preservers, who seeded the galaxy with Humans and humanoids; it is supported by Lt. Commander Spock, the Enterprise's own Vulcan Science Officer.

gsx$event.$t: The Vulcan Academy of Science stuns the Federation, but helps to allay fears of Vulcan/Romulan collusion, when it publicises its theory concerning the Romulans' Vulcan heritage. This theory postulates a race known as The Preservers, who seeded the galaxy with Humans and humanoids; it is supported by Lt. Commander Spock, the Enterprise's own Vulcan Science Officer.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: A Starfleet-sponsored science team, composed of Vulcan researchers and lead by Lt. Cdr. Spock on temporary detached duty, re-discovers a Vulcan colony world that had been captured by Romulan Forces. Located in the area between UFP/Romulan/Klingon space known as The Triangle, the mining settlement had been abandoned by the Romulans as unsuccessful when its ores played out. The Romulans destroyed all records and equipment before leaving, stranding the Vulcan inhabitants. By the time the scientists arrive, most of the Vulcans had died, but a Vulcan/Romulan hybrid child, a girl of 5, survives. Sarek, a highly respected scientist/statesman from Vulcan, is given custody of the child Saavik, who was born soon after the Romulans had departed. Starfleet has little opportunity to question her.

gsx$event.$t: A Starfleet-sponsored science team, composed of Vulcan researchers and lead by Lt. Cdr. Spock on temporary detached duty, re-discovers a Vulcan colony world that had been captured by Romulan Forces. Located in the area between UFP/Romulan/Klingon space known as The Triangle, the mining settlement had been abandoned by the Romulans as unsuccessful when its ores played out. The Romulans destroyed all records and equipment before leaving, stranding the Vulcan inhabitants. By the time the scientists arrive, most of the Vulcans had died, but a Vulcan/Romulan hybrid child, a girl of 5, survives. Sarek, a highly respected scientist/statesman from Vulcan, is given custody of the child Saavik, who was born soon after the Romulans had departed. Starfleet has little opportunity to question her.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: The first shots of what would have been the Second Klingon War are stilled by the Organians, who impose a peace treaty on both sides of the budding conflict. The preparation for war and the aftermath of the imposed peace delay the Federation Council's final action on the Romulan border attack and the theorized Romulan/Vulcan link. When the Council returns to the problem, first contact with the Gorn gives them yet another, more urgent matter to handle. Though Starfleet doubles the number of patrols along the Neutral Zone and establishes new, larger, more heavily armed border stations, no direct action is taken against the Romulans at this time.

gsx$event.$t: The first shots of what would have been the Second Klingon War are stilled by the Organians, who impose a peace treaty on both sides of the budding conflict. The preparation for war and the aftermath of the imposed peace delay the Federation Council's final action on the Romulan border attack and the theorized Romulan/Vulcan link. When the Council returns to the problem, first contact with the Gorn gives them yet another, more urgent matter to handle. Though Starfleet doubles the number of patrols along the Neutral Zone and establishes new, larger, more heavily armed border stations, no direct action is taken against the Romulans at this time.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Deeep-cover agents within the Klingon Empire report that the Klingons and Romulans have been settling their border disputes and likely have sealed cease-fire agreements with exchanges of military technology. In the resulting, almost immediate shake-up in Starfleet Intelligence, the entire staff of the Bureau of Romulan Affairs is fired and replaced. Council members favoring a stronger stand against the Romulans feel they have a mandate because of the strength of public opinion, and they draft top-secret resolutions commissioning Operation Purloin.

gsx$event.$t: Deeep-cover agents within the Klingon Empire report that the Klingons and Romulans have been settling their border disputes and likely have sealed cease-fire agreements with exchanges of military technology. In the resulting, almost immediate shake-up in Starfleet Intelligence, the entire staff of the Bureau of Romulan Affairs is fired and replaced. Council members favoring a stronger stand against the Romulans feel they have a mandate because of the strength of public opinion, and they draft top-secret resolutions commissioning Operation Purloin.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Operation Purloin is put into effect when Captain James Kirk of USS Enterprise is captured by 3 Romulan battlecruisers, of Klijngon design and equipped with the Romulan cloaking device. Commander Spock, Enterprise Science Officer also acting under sealed orders, informs the Romulans that Kirk has acted on his own initiative and out of a misguided and perhaps insane desire for personal glory. He gains the confidence of the Romulan commander and distracts her long enough fo Kirk, disguised as a Romulan, to steal a prototype of the cloaking device from the Romulan flagship. The clever ruse succeeds, and the Enterprise escapes when Chief Engineer Scott is able to hook the purloined device into the Federation ship's own circuits and activate it. The Federation makes a major military gain when the device is delivered to Starfleet Headquarters.

gsx$event.$t: Operation Purloin is put into effect when Captain James Kirk of USS Enterprise is captured by 3 Romulan battlecruisers, of Klijngon design and equipped with the Romulan cloaking device. Commander Spock, Enterprise Science Officer also acting under sealed orders, informs the Romulans that Kirk has acted on his own initiative and out of a misguided and perhaps insane desire for personal glory. He gains the confidence of the Romulan commander and distracts her long enough fo Kirk, disguised as a Romulan, to steal a prototype of the cloaking device from the Romulan flagship. The clever ruse succeeds, and the Enterprise escapes when Chief Engineer Scott is able to hook the purloined device into the Federation ship's own circuits and activate it. The Federation makes a major military gain when the device is delivered to Starfleet Headquarters.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Despite intense examination by the best minds in Starfleet, the Romulan cloaking device remains a mystery. Nevertheless, political pressure forces the Federation to make public display of the stolen device. Again installed on a Federation ship, this one filled with dignitaries and influential people from all over the UFP, the ship vanishes from view. To the horror of the test's organizers and the Federation Council who pressed for the test over the advice from Starfleet Research and Exploration scientists, the ship never reappeared. Subsequent attempts to duplicate the cloaking device meet with complete failure. Council members who advocated a harder stance against the Romulans, and who gained in stature because of the success of Operation Purloin, lose credibility because of the disaster.

gsx$event.$t: Despite intense examination by the best minds in Starfleet, the Romulan cloaking device remains a mystery. Nevertheless, political pressure forces the Federation to make public display of the stolen device. Again installed on a Federation ship, this one filled with dignitaries and influential people from all over the UFP, the ship vanishes from view. To the horror of the test's organizers and the Federation Council who pressed for the test over the advice from Starfleet Research and Exploration scientists, the ship never reappeared. Subsequent attempts to duplicate the cloaking device meet with complete failure. Council members who advocated a harder stance against the Romulans, and who gained in stature because of the success of Operation Purloin, lose credibility because of the disaster.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: An abandoned Romulan planetary base is discovered on Eridam, a mining world near The Triangle, with its Romulan inhabitants wiped out by an epidemic disease known to affect Vulcans. No military information is gained, but personal diaries, children's books, works of fiction, and other non-military writings are recovered. This body of work, known as the Eridam papers, addds much to the Federation's meager store of knowledge about the Romulans. The Vulcan connection is supported by anatomical drawings, by Romulan legends, and by children's history books. Romulan history and motivations become better understood, giving some basis for u nderstanding what has been a "faceless" enemy.

gsx$event.$t: An abandoned Romulan planetary base is discovered on Eridam, a mining world near The Triangle, with its Romulan inhabitants wiped out by an epidemic disease known to affect Vulcans. No military information is gained, but personal diaries, children's books, works of fiction, and other non-military writings are recovered. This body of work, known as the Eridam papers, addds much to the Federation's meager store of knowledge about the Romulans. The Vulcan connection is supported by anatomical drawings, by Romulan legends, and by children's history books. Romulan history and motivations become better understood, giving some basis for u nderstanding what has been a "faceless" enemy.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Based upon the Eridam Papers, some political thinkers speculate that negotiation may be possible with the Star Empire, though others see no hope for negotiation and press for even stronger measures to curb what conservatives have come to call the Romulan Threat. The net result is both a stronger military presence along the Neutral Zone and near The Triangle, and a push to gather as much intelligence data as possible about the Romulans in hopes of making field commanders more aware of Romulan capabilities and tactics.

gsx$event.$t: Based upon the Eridam Papers, some political thinkers speculate that negotiation may be possible with the Star Empire, though others see no hope for negotiation and press for even stronger measures to curb what conservatives have come to call the Romulan Threat. The net result is both a stronger military presence along the Neutral Zone and near The Triangle, and a push to gather as much intelligence data as possible about the Romulans in hopes of making field commanders more aware of Romulan capabilities and tactics.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Saavik, ward of Sarek of Vulcan, enters Starfleet Academy. Family prestige and the personal intervention of Sarek's famous son Spock heads off a storm of controversy over t he admission of a "Romulan" to the Academy. Though only a half-Romulan and raised as a Vulcan, Saavik is seen as an enemy alien by many Federation bigots, including those who lost many family members to the Romulans. Nevertheless, Saavic, who has embraced Vulcan teachings, is a valuable resource to Starfleet, for whom she interprets intelligence data about the Romulans. Because of her help, many myths are put to rest and a better understanding of Romulan psychology develops.

gsx$event.$t: Saavik, ward of Sarek of Vulcan, enters Starfleet Academy. Family prestige and the personal intervention of Sarek's famous son Spock heads off a storm of controversy over t he admission of a "Romulan" to the Academy. Though only a half-Romulan and raised as a Vulcan, Saavik is seen as an enemy alien by many Federation bigots, including those who lost many family members to the Romulans. Nevertheless, Saavic, who has embraced Vulcan teachings, is a valuable resource to Starfleet, for whom she interprets intelligence data about the Romulans. Because of her help, many myths are put to rest and a better understanding of Romulan psychology develops.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: Saavik graduates Starfleet Academy at the top of her class. Promoted to Lieutenant JG, she is assigned at the request of Captain Spock to take her Cadet Cruise aboard the Enterprise. She serves during the infamouse "Wrath of Khan" incident, and she is given a Starfleet commendation and a field promotion to full lieutenant. She is transferred to the USS Grissom for the survey of the Genesis Planet.

gsx$event.$t: Saavik graduates Starfleet Academy at the top of her class. Promoted to Lieutenant JG, she is assigned at the request of Captain Spock to take her Cadet Cruise aboard the Enterprise. She serves during the infamouse "Wrath of Khan" incident, and she is given a Starfleet commendation and a field promotion to full lieutenant. She is transferred to the USS Grissom for the survey of the Genesis Planet.

content.$t: full: FALSE, event: A Romulan-design, Klingon scoutship is delivered to Vulcan by James Kirk and his companions.Carrying a cloaking device, it was captured by Kirk after the destruction of the USS Enterprise in a Klingon attack before the Genesis Planet exploded.

gsx$event.$t: A Romulan-design, Klingon scoutship is delivered to Vulcan by James Kirk and his companions.Carrying a cloaking device, it was captured by Kirk after the destruction of the USS Enterprise in a Klingon attack before the Genesis Planet exploded.
